abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Heilongjiang Dairy
            Project for China were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was moderately unsatisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the project was focused on a
            single sub-sector. The basis for this focus was a careful
            analysis of the sector, potential market growth and the
            physical conditions in the province. The selection of the
            dairy sector for support was therefore done properly and
            this was demonstrated in the project to be an appropriate
            choice. Many farmers have benefitted from the project.
            However, a single sector focus also comes with risks and is
            susceptible to supply and demand shocks which can have a
            major impact on project implementation. This vulnerability
            needs to be recognized and explicitly addressed during
            preparation and appraisal. Although the specific external
            shocks could not always have been predicted, the risks are
            apparent, especially for livestock related sectors. All
            intensive livestock sectors must pay close attention to
            livestock waste management issues as these are elements for
            the success and sustainability of investments in the sector.
            Under this project, although provisions were in place to
            ensure that appropriate waste management facilities were
            included in the infrastructure development, there was an
            over-reliance on the environmental protection bureau to
            monitor and enforce compliance. Future International Bank
            for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) projects might
            consider to including the financing of waste management
            (which has a public good justification). Monitoring and
            evaluation received too little attention from the project
            implementation agency, which may have not recognized the
            importance of this and therefore were unwilling to devote
            sufficient time and resources. Some indicators could have
            been better designed to make them easier to measure. If
            monitoring and evaluation (M&E) systems under perform
            during project implementation, Bank teams need to facilitate
            the execution of evaluative studies at the Mid Term Review
            (MTR) and after project completion.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Heilongjiang Dairy Project for China
            has two key development objectives. The first objective is
            to improve the financial viability of existing and new dairy
            operations (about 10,000 HH) in selected areas of
            Heilongjiang province. The second objective is to
            demonstrate innovative technologies to reduce greenhouse gas
            (GHG) emissions and increase carbon sequestration. The
            ministry of finance and Heilongjiang province have the
            following changes to the project: i) extension of the
            closing dates of the International Bank for Reconstruction
            and Development (IBRD) Loan and Italian grant by twelve
            months, from December 31, 2010 to December 31, 2011; ii)
            reduction in the scope of activities and the cancellation of
            USD30 million from the IBRD Loan; iii) reallocation of funds
            under the Italian grant; and iv) the revision of indicators
            and targets in the monitoring table to reflect these
            changes. The changes are justified by the numerous delays,
            mostly from external factors beyond the control of the
            project, which have hampered project implementation, and
            also changes in the dairy sector which have reduced the
            demand for the project activities, notably the reluctance of
            small-scale farmers to invest in dairy cattle.

display_title.display_title:
China - Heilongjiang Dairy
            Project : restructuring : Main report
